intro: Lagenandra kalugalensis, commonly known as the Kalugalensis starfruit, is a tropical plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with simple, opposite leaves. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, while the fruit develops from the flower and is edible when ripe. The botanical features of Lagenandra kalugalensis make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
